case_title: AKBAR ALI vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and others
legal_basis: Section 4 of the Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974

key_facts.promotion_to_head_constable: After passing Al and B1 examinations

issues.accelerated_promotion: Granted due to extraordinary performance and courage.
issues.reversion: Based on failure to pass intermediate school course exams.

arguments.appellant: Accelerated promotion was a reward for extraordinary performance and should not be subject to standard rules of promotion.
arguments.respondent: Promotion to A.S.I. requires passing mandatory courses as per Police Rules.

judgment_summary.decision: Accelerated promotion granted as a reward cannot be revoked due to failure in exams.
judgment_summary.principle: Rights conferred through accelerated promotion cannot be taken away later.
judgment_summary.appellant_status: Reinstated as A.S.I. with entitlement to back benefits.
